findings.title: Incorrect value of ltafPercentage
findings.description: The value of ltafPercentage does not match with documented Large Transaction Authorisation Feature (LTAF). In the code base the value of ltafPercentage equals to 60, however, it is stated in the documentation that “In a month, the maximum transaction cannot exceed 50% of the total balance”.

findings.title: Hash Collisions With Multiple Variable Length Arguments
findings.description: When using abi.encodePacked(), it’s crucial to ensure that a matching signature cannot be achieved using different parameters. Alternatively, you can simply use abi.encode() instead.

findings.title: Uninitialized Storage Pointer
findings.description: Uninitialized local storage variables can point to unexpected storage locations in the contract.

findings.title: Transaction Order Dependence
findings.description: A possible way to remedy for race conditions in submission of information in exchange for a reward is called a commit reveal hash scheme.

findings.title: Authorization through tx.origin
findings.description: tx.origin should not be used for authorization. Use msg.sender instead.

findings.title: Insufficient Gas Griefing
findings.description: Insuffci ient gas griefing attacks can be performed on contracts which accept data and use it in a sub-call on another contract. To avoid them, only allow trusted users to relay transactions and require that the forwarder provides enough gas.
